titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Alexandre Polovtsoff Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 09:07

did.unittitle: Alexandre Polovtsoff papers

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: Notes, manuscripts, and transcript copies of Alexandre Polovtsoff's (1867-1934) writings after his emigration from Russia in 1918. Included are autobiographical materials, articles on Russian art, the imperial palaces, and Russian historical figures; also, translations of the Journal de Voyage en Russie by Francisco de Miranda, and The Curse of Wit by A. S. Griboedov.

langmaterial.language: The materials are in Russian, French, and English.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Alexandre Polovtsoff Papers (MS 403). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Born in St. Petersburg in 1867, Polovtsoff grew up amid the cultivated society of the era; as a young man, he served several years in the cavalry (1888-1892), afterwards entering the Ministry of Internal Affairs, where he held responsible positions and travelled extensively through Russia and the outlying provinces. He also served as a foreign diplomat, one of his more protracted assignments being a post with the Russian Embassy in Bombay, 1906-1909. He maintained an active interest in Russian art and engaged in such activities as the organization of the Exhibition of Russian Art in London in 1935, also writing several articles and speeches on the subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of notes, manuscripts and typescript copies of the writings of Alexandre Polovtsoff, between the time of his emigration from Russia in 1918 and his death. His autobiographical works contain reminiscences from his youth and accounts of his later official work. His book, Les trésors d'art en Russie sous le régime bolchéviste, published in Paris, 1919, and found here in manuscript form as "Le Bolchévisme et les palais imperiaux," describes his efforts to protect the imperial palaces of Russia immediately after the Revolution in 1917, before his emigration.

The bulk of the collection consists of various historical writings. The only one of these works to have been published is Les Favoris de Catherine la Grande, Paris, 1939; but the collection contains an extended study of Peter the Great, and articles, sketches, and notes on various Russian monarchs and other historical figures. There are also some translations: the Journal de Voyage en Russie of Don Francisco de Miranda (from Spanish), and The Curse of Wit of A. S. Griboedov (from Russian).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

did.unittitle: Inventory of the Papers
Historical writings: Peter I, emperor of Russia, 1672-1725; Catherine I, empress of Russia, d. 1727; Elizabeth, empress of Russia, 1709-1762
Notes on Peter I (notebook)
"Pierre le Grand vu par un temoin étranger" [Bergholz] (notebook)
Petr Veliki? [Peter the Great] p.257-272, "L'oeuvre de Pierre le Grand..." [On Elizabeth, empress of Russia] (notebook)
Petr Velikiĭ [Peter the Great] Vol. I (typescript)
Petr Velikiĭ [Peter the Great] Vol. II (typescript)
"Catherine I of Russia" (typescript)
"The daughter of Peter the Great (Elizabeth, Empress of Russia)" (notebook)
Historical writings: Catherine II, empress of Russia, 1729-1796; Paul I, emperor of Russia, 1754-1801; Marie Feodorovna, empress consort of Paul I, 1759-1828
Notes on Les Favoris de la Grande Catherine (notebook)
Notes on Les Favoris de Catherine II (13 p., typescript)
"Lettres de Catherine II a Mlle. Liovchine," 22 Aug 1771 - 1775 (notebook, copy by Polovtsoff)
"Lettres de Mlle. Liovchine a Catherine II," winter 1771 - 9 Apr 1780 (copy by Polovtsoff)
"Yubileĭ Smol'nogo" [On Smolny, convent school founded by Catherine II]
"Catherine II et Mlle. Liovchine" (notebook)
"Catherine II" (typescript)
Les Favoris de Catherine II (typescript)
"Le Voyage du Comte et de la Comtesse du Nord" [Paul I and Marie Feodorovna] (notebook)
"Yubile? Smol'nogo" (notebook)
"The Count and Countess of the North" [Paul I and Marie Feodorovna]
"To many people the Exhibition of Russian Art at Belgrave Square...." (notebook)
"Un Portrait inédit de la Comtesse du Nord" [Marie Feodorovna] (typescript)
Historical writings: Various figures in Russian history
"Pushkin – peve Rossii" [On A. S. Pushkin (1799-1837)]
"Les Chinois quoique beaucoup plus libre à une époque reculée que nous..." [essay on early conditions in Russia] (notebook)
Copy of letter of Count Alexander Andreevich Bezborodko to "Mesdemoiselles les grises, de la Communauté de Demoiselles Nobles" St. Petersburg, 3 May 1770 (manuscript)

odd.head: General
odd.p: Bezborodko (1746-1799) was head of dept. of foreign affairs and advisor to Catherine II and Paul I.

did.unittitle: "Extraits des Memoires de Photius," copied from "Archives Russes," 1869, page 937

odd.head: General
odd.p: Archimandrite Photius (Peter Nikitich Spasky, 1792-1838) was a reactionary ecclesiastical leader during the reign of Alexander I.

did.unittitle: Essay (in Russian) on Count Ilarion Ivanovich Vorontsov-Dashkov

odd.head: General
odd.p: Vorontsov-Dashkov (1837-1916) was minister of the imperial household and later viceroy of the Caucasus.

did.unittitle: Extraits des memoires d'A. Gribovsky (écrits en 1830) [On the court of Catherine II]
Notes on Catherine II (notebook)
"Romanoff (Dynasty)"
"Un Grand Seigneur Russe Jacobin" [Stroganoff, Alexander, count, 1733-1795] (typescript)
"Polovt︠s︡y" by Alexander Saltykov (newspaper clipping, probably printed in Paris, 1935)
"Un espagnol à la cour de Catherine II" [Don Francisco de Miranda] (typescript, carbon copy)
Journal de Voyage en Russie by Don Francisco de Miranda [trans. by A. A. Polovtsoff and Léon Bobrinsky] (typescript)
Vol. 1

Writings on the imperial palaces and Russian art

odd.p: See also: box 2, folder 3 box 5, folder 1
